org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.data.pack

Class PackTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture<T>
      • org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.AbstractTask<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>>
        • org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.data.pack.PackTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ListenableFuture<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>>, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>>, EvalTask<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>>

    public class PackTask
extends AbstractTask<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>>
    Pack data sets. This task returns a list of the data sets. It can pack both data sources and train-test data sets, in which case it packs the test and training data. It returns the packed data sets.
    Since:
    2.1

      • setIncludeTimestamps

        public void setIncludeTimestamps(boolean include)
        Set whether to include timestamps.
        Parameters:
        include - If true (the default), timestamps will be packed.

      • getIncludeTimestamps

        public boolean getIncludeTimestamps()
        Get whether to include timestamps.
        Returns:
        Whether or not timestamps will be included.

      • setOutputFile

        public void setOutputFile(Function<DataSource,java.io.File> func)
        Set the function to produce the default files for each data source. The function will take data sources and produce the files into which they should be packed. The default function packs CSV data sources into binary files next to their source files, and other data sources into files with unique names in the pack directory.
        Parameters:
        func - The function.
